sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词或短语动词均有"死，死亡"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: die, decease, expire, perish, pass away
means: die ： 最普通用词，指某人或某物失去生命而永远不存在。
decease ： 正式用词，多指法律上的用语。
expire ： 委婉用词。从本义"从肺部吐出气来"引申为吐出最后一口气，断气而死。
perish ： 书面用词，多指夭折或不幸暴亡。

复制阳模：如用金属或特制的人造石一类合适的坚硬物质，制成牙齿模型的正复制品。见counterdie

sentence.Network_cn: 一项新的研究确证了吸烟者比不吸烟者死得早。

encyclopedia.content: Die Die是日本著名金属乐队Dir en grey的节奏吉他手。 Die的真名为安滕大助（Andou Daisuke）他取了自己名字中的“Dai”转变成很特别的"Die"作为艺名。 Dir en grey的前身是L~a Sadies,Die同现在Dir en grey的主唱京、鼓手Shinya,同是LS的最初成员。1997年，随着主音吉他手薰（kaoru）（Dir en grey队长）和贝司手Toshiya的相继加入，Dir en grey正式成立。在地下时期已创造了第一次地下乐队单曲登上Oricon排行榜、第一

entry.def: When people, animals, and plants die, they stop living.

example.ex: A year later my dog died...
Sadly, both he and my mother died of cancer...
example.tran: 非常不幸的是，他和我母亲都死于癌症。

entry.def: If a person, animal, or plant is dying, they are so ill or so badly injured that they will not live very much longer.

example.ex: The elm trees are all dying...
example.tran: 那些榆树全都奄奄一息了。

example.ex: Every working day I treat people who are dying from lung diseases caused by smoking.
example.tran: 每天上班我都要医治那些因吸烟患上肺病的垂危患者。

entry.def: If someone dies a violent, unnatural, or painful death, they die in a violent, unnatural, or painful way.

example.ex: He watched helplessly as his mother died an agonizing death...
example.tran: 他无助地看着母亲痛苦地死去。

example.ex: I'm no expert, but I don't think Tracy died a natural death.
example.tran: 我不是什么专家，但我不认为特蕾西是自然死亡。

entry.def: If a machine or device dies, it stops completely, especially after a period of working more and more slowly or inefficiently.

example.ex: Then suddenly, the engine coughed, spluttered and died.
example.tran: 然后，发动机突然咔咔地响着，发出一阵噼啪声，接着就彻底熄火了。

entry.def: If a fire or light dies, it stops burning or shining.

example.ex: Her cigarette glowed brightly, then died.
example.tran: 她的香烟燃起一阵亮光，然后就熄灭了。

entry.def: If an emotion or facial expression dies, it disappears completely, usually after a period of gradually becoming weaker and less noticeable.

example.ex: My love for you will never die...
Kathryn looked down at the floor and the smile died on her lips.
example.tran: 凯瑟琳低头看向地板，笑容从她的嘴角消失了。

entry.tran: (渴、饿、闷或好奇)得要命;…得要死
entry.def: You can say that you are dying of thirst, hunger, boredom, or curiosity to emphasize that you are very thirsty, hungry, bored, or curious.

example.ex: Order me a pot of tea, I'm dying of thirst.
example.tran: 给我来一壶茶，我快要渴死了。

entry.def: You can say that you are dying for something or are dying to do something to emphasize that you very much want to have it or do it.

example.ex: I'm dying for a breath of fresh air...
example.tran: 我非常渴望能呼吸到新鲜空气。

example.ex: She was dying to talk to Frank.

entry.tran: (用于强调震惊、不安、窘迫或好笑等)我差点要死/（如果发生某事）我会死的
entry.def: You can use die in expressions such as 'I almost died' or 'I'd die if anything happened' where you are emphasizing your feelings about a situation, for example to say that it is very shocking, upsetting, embarrassing, or amusing.

example.ex: I nearly died when I learned where I was ending up...
example.tran: 得知自己到了哪里时，我简直要晕过去了。

entry.def: A die is a specially shaped or patterned block of metal which is used to press or cut other metal into a particular shape.
You can say that the die is cast to draw attention to the importance of an event or decision which is going to affect your future and which cannot be changed or avoided.

example.ex: It was too late and too urgent to turn back. The die was cast.
example.tran: 现在为时已晚，来不及回头。事情已成定局了。

entry.tran: (习惯或观念)难以改掉，很难摆脱
entry.def: If you say that habits or attitudes die hard, you mean that they take a very long time to disappear or change, so that it may not be possible to get rid of them completely.

means.word_mean: 1. small cubes with 1 to 6 spots on the faces; used to generate random numbers
2. a device used for shaping metal
3. a cutting tool that is fitted into a diestock and used for cutting male (external) screw threads on screws or bolts or pipes or rods
1. pass from physical life and lose all all bodily attributes and functions necessary to sustain life;
2. suffer or face the pain of death;

sentences.sentence: "Martyrs may die every day for their faith"

means.word_mean: 3. be brought to or as if to the point of death by an intense emotion such as embarrassment, amusement, or shame;

sentences.sentence: "I was dying with embarrassment when my little lie was discovered"
"We almost died laughing during the show"
"The bus we travelled in broke down on the way to town"
"The engine failed on the way to town"
"She died to worldly things and eventually entered a monastery"

means.word_mean: 6. languish as with love or desire;
7. cut or shape with a die;
8. to be on base at the end of an inning, of a player
10. disappear or come to an end;
11. suffer spiritual death; be damned (in the religious sense);

list.explanation: 尽心竭力的(地)，顽强的(地)，不达目的决不罢休的(地)

example.en: He has the obsessive do or die attitude.
example.zh: 他具有极其顽强的态度。

example.en: I was determined to get there—do or die.
example.zh: 我已下定决心要去那儿——不到那儿誓不罢休。

example.en: We had a beautiful room at the hotel and the service was to die for.
example.zh: 我们住在那家旅馆里，不仅房间很漂亮，而且服务很周到。

Sentence.sentence: But while printing quickly caused the hand written book to die out, handwriting lingered on (继续存在) well into the 16th century.
Her father died when she was 21 and she inherited 7.
When she died in 1916 she left her children 100 million dollars
So when fly the north, they might lay eggs in Louisiana and die.
trees that are dying usually give out a soft moan
That's the sound of a dying forest.
